descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.
Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: Scott Padgett scored a career-high 17 points Tuesday night, and the Utah Jazz handed the Phoenix Suns their season-worst fourth straight loss, 98-84 Tuesday night.
article.headline: Padgett's career-high 17 help Jazz stay hot

images.name: Malone_Karl 010802 inline
images.caption: Jazz forward Karl Malone shoots for two of his 17 points.

article.linkText: Surging Jazz send Suns to fourth straight loss
article.story:
SALT LAKE CITY (AP) -- Scott Padgett is making the most of his increased playing time lately. The 6-foot-9 third-year forward scored a career-high 17 points, including three 3-pointers, to help the Utah Jazz beat the Phoenix Suns 98-84 Tuesday night for their sixth victory in seven games. "When I'm hitting 3s, it picks up every other part of my game. It pumps me up," Padgett said. Padgett, who scored 12 of his points in the second quarter, played so well that the man he replaced on the floor, Karl Malone, didn't come back in until after halftime. "That doesn't happen often, but I though Scott Padgett did a terrific job," Utah coach Jerry Sloan said. "It was hard to take him off the floor, and he deserved to play." Malone scored 15 of his 17 points in the second half, but it was Padgett and Utah's reserves who made the difference, outscoring the Suns' substitutes 49-24. Jarron Collins also had a career best with 13 points, Bryon Russell scored 11, and John Crotty added 10 for the Jazz (18-16), who are two games above .500 for the first time this season. Shawn Marion and Rodney Rogers each scored 17 for Phoenix (18-17), which has lost a season-worst four games. "We're playing good teams but we're not meeting the challenge," Suns guard Penny Hardaway said. "When we didn't match their intensity, they just took off." In his last game, Padgett tied a career high with 16 points in Utah's win at Chicago on Saturday. "He's getting opportunities now, and I'm glad to see that for Scott," Malone said. After the Suns closed to 75-67, Malone, playing with four Utah substitutes, sparked a 9-0 Jazz run with five points. Crotty capped the surge with a 3-pointer to give Utah a 84-67 lead with 8:05 left. Utah's substitutes turned a 30-16 first quarter deficit into a 51-39 halftime lead. The Jazz never trailed after that big run. "We never did got any sort of rhythm going after that," Phoenix coach Scott Skiles said. For a team that ranks near the bottom of the league in 3-point field goals and percentage, Padgett's strong shooting was important. Utah made 6-of-10 from beyond the arc. Padgett is "shooting with a lot of confidence and he's executing our offense," Sloan said. "He knows where he's supposed to go because he's been here a while."

Game notes
Malone played in his 1,307th game, tying Buck Williams for fifth place on the NBA career list. ... Suns center Jake Tsakalidis, who had missed eight games with a sprained right hand, was activated before the game. Tom Gugliotta took his place on the injured list. ... Malone and Stephon Marbury, the teams' top scorers, each had just two points in the first half. ... Marion scored seven points in less than two minutes in the first quarter to give Phoenix a 14-4 lead.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
